channel.title: Where should i start?
channel.description: before i get into building servers, where should i start learning java? what would you prefer, Videos or e books/books i know of a guy making vids for java on youtube name is Bucky, are his videos good for learning this kind of stuff? k thanks!

item.title: Where should i start?
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

imsocruel:

k thanks both of you, should i start with little things like, text based, or GUI stuff first?

Since your posting this in the Runescape Classic section why dont you use runescape classic to help further your
knowledge of the JAVA Language?

Here might be a fun little task. Not sure if you will be able to write it… if not you can always ask for help

Write an npc that asks if player x would like to participate in a little game for a certain amount of coins.
Player x needs to guess a number 1-5 and if the player x guesses the correct number. Player x then
receives whatever amount of coins.

util.random

Read full topic

item.title: Where should i start?
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

[quote=“imsocruel, post:4, topic:355002”]thanks!, i have no idea what you mean by syntax… do you mean like the commands? strings,booleans,ints,doubles?

also how would i start with the calendar?[/quote]

Start by giving your class file a main target.
public static void main(String args[])
and a window lol.
http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/components/frame.html
http://www.apl.jhu.edu/~hall/java/Swing-Tutorial/Swing-Tutorial-JFrame.html

Read full topic

item.title: Where should i start?
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/index.html

Its about how you learn. If you learn alot quicker watching youtube videos…watch youtube videos.
I catch onto things alot quicker when I read them from a text book… a local library should
have some computer books.
